PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Codex - Eﬃciency, Dynamicity and Composition for XML Models, Algorithms, and Systems.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Уrgгo financiador: ANR (Agence Nationale de la Recherche - Franзa). Vigкncia: Novembro 2008 a novembro 2010 Coordenador: Ioana Manolescu (Inria Saclay, Franзa) Participante: Martin Musicante (UFRN, como parte da equipe da Universidade de Tours, campus de Blois). Resumo: The research work we propose to undertake seeks to push the frontier of XML technology innovation in three interconnected directions. First, we propose to study languages, algorithms, and develop prototypes for eﬃcient and expressive XML processing, in particular advancing towards massively distributed XML repositories. Second, we will consider models for describing, controlling, and reacting to the dynamic behavior of XML corporas and XML schemas with time. Third, we propose theories, models and prototypes for composing XML programs for richer interactions, and XML schemas into rich, expressive, yet formally grounded type descriptions. Instituiзхes participantes: Saclay (Gemo group of INRIA), Lille (Mostrare group of INRIA), Paris Sud (Paris Sud, Sorbonne), Paris 7 (PPS), Grenoble (Centre de recherche Grenoble-Rh?one-Alpes, LIF Marseille), Blois (LI - Universitй Franзois Rabelais Tours), Innovimax (Innovimax SARL).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: EEXML - Extensao de Esquemas para XML
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Уrgгo financiador: CNPq - PDPG (Pequenos Grupos) Vigкncia: Decembro 2004 a junho 2007 Coordenador: Martin Musicante (UFRN) Resumo: A crescente informatizaзгo das organizaзхes tem provocado uma grande demanda por aplicaзхes web. A troca de dados entre aplicaзхes na Internet hoje faz parte do cotidiano de industrias, comйrcios, laboratуrios de pesquisa e repartiзхes pъblicas. Neste contexto, й comum que o administrador dos dados nгo seja um especialista em computaзгo mas alguйm com formaзгo no domнnio de aplicaзгo dos dados a serem compartilhados. Este administrador possui, em geral, conhecimento tecnolуgico sobre XML e sobre algumas das ferramentas de software usadas no tratamento de documentos XML, assim como sobre a forma (ou esquema) dos dados que estгo sendo trocados. O problema a ser abordado no presente projeto consiste na proposta de uma ferramenta que auxilie o administrador dos dados a efetuar a mudanзa do esquema, de forma a garantir a preservaзгo da consistкncia de documentos antigos. Para isto, vamos supor que o administrador conta com a definiзгo do esquema antigo, que deve ser mudado, e com um documento que nгo verifica esse esquema mas que deve verificar o novo esquema a ser proposto pela ferramenta. O documento em questгo deve ser o resultado de uma sequкncia de modificaзхes em um documento vбlido (em relaзгo ao esquema original). Este projeto visa a soluзгo do problema exposto acima mediante a aplicaзгo de tйcnicas de aprendizado de mбquina ainda nгo exploradas no contexto acima descrito, tais como Computaзгo Evolucionбria (Programaзгo Genйtica, Programaзгo Evolucionбria). Instituiзхes participantes: UFRN, UFPR, Unicentro (Guarapuava-PR), Universidade de Tours (Campus de Blois, Franзa)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Especificaзгo e Implementaзгo de Serviзos Web usando a Linguagem PEWS
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Уrgгo financiador: CNPq - Edital Universal 2007 Vigкncia: Novembro 2007 a novembro 2009 Coordenador: Martin Musicante (UFRN) Resumo: Serviзos Web sгo sistemas de software acessнveis via Internet e capazes de intermediar a comunicaзгo entre o usuбrio do serviзo e o servidor (computador) que executa a aplicaзгo. Serviзos web trocam mesangens XML e, muitas vezes, precisam reconciliar nгo sу a estrutura ou tipo das differentes mensagens mas a ordem em que estas mensagens devem ser enviadas ou recebidas. Este processo deve ser executado em um ambiente distribuнdo. Diversas liguagens para a descriзгo de interfaces de serviзos web jб foram propostas. Poucas dentre elas tentaram conciliar a capacidade de descrever o comportamento da interface a um formalismo que permita a verificaзгo da correзгo das especificaзхes. PEWS й uma linguagem de especificaзгo de interfaces de serviзos web que se enquadra neste novo contexto. Programas em PEWS definem padrхes de controle, de forma a especificar a ordem em que as operaзхes de um serviзo web podem ser executadas, ou melhor, a ordem a respeitar para garantir a interaзгo entre as mensagens do serviзo com outros serviзos externos. Nossos primieros trabalhos nesta бrea propхem uma primeira definiзгo de PEWS assim como a utilizaзгo da teoria das traces como formalismo para verificaзхes de especificaзхes. Contamos atualmente com um protуtipo na forma de um plug-in do ambiente Eclipse. Neste projeto visamos continuar com o dsenvolvimento da linguagem, assim como do ferramental teуrico necessбrio para o raciocнnio sobre programas escritos em PEWS, visando o desenvolvimento de serviзos web que cumpram com a sua especificaзгo.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: e-ClouDss : building e-governement Clouds using Distributed semantic services
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A mashup is an application that presents content available from different sources by reusing the contents provided by third parties (e.g Web pages, Web services). A service is an autonomous software that offers some functionality through a network. Services coordination can be used for mashing up services and thereby specifying application logic by (i) capturing the interactions and dependencies among services; and (ii) by specifying reliability properties that the system must ensure such as connection, security, availability, persistency, etc. e-ClouDS focusses on reliability of mashed up systems represented as non functional properties that describe how the execution must be done with respect to some observable attributes. Such properties conduct to built reliable mashups. Although numerous systems, models and languages have been proposed for supporting non functional properties, they are ad-hoc solutions that weave application logic with non functional properties. This results into mashup-up services difficult to evolve and maintain. We believe that this limitation can be avoided be promoting separation of concerns such that reliability can be finely grained personalized for given mashed-up services: some services in the mash-up might need to run under secure connection conditions, others might need authentication, etc. Web Services Description Language (WSDL) enables to describe WS by specifying their locations and their operations. However, such a description leaves unspecified behavioural aspects or the order in which operations should be invoked to achieve certain goals. Hence, the notion of Semantic WebService (SWS) [Martin04] has arosen recently making it possible to automatize dicovering, selection and composition of WS by adding meta-data to WS descriptions. Semantic descriptions permit also the comparison of WS functionality. There exist different approaches to giving semantics to WS: OWL-S [Martin04] and Web Service Modeling Ontology (WSMO), which desc

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Semantic Web Analytics: Processing Big Data on Energy Consumption
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: SWANS proposes a big data processing service-based framework for supporting experts and non-experts analysis on energy consumption. Building big data collections implies analyzing intranets, deep web and open web data, to discover events that cause different energy consumption behaviors, for example, high consumption of energy. SWANS main challenges are the efficient manipulation of huge amounts of data on the cloud with data coming from heterogeneous data sources producing different types of data, smart me- ters, sensors, home and personal utilities. The main objective in SWANS is to address the theoretical aspects of the semantic analytics service?based framework on the cloud thanks to the complementary expertise of all partners and to begin a fruitful col- laboration around Energy Information Systems for energy-care through the development of some big data analysis tools. The Energy Semantics Web Analytic framework will incorporate: (1) the automatic and semi- automatic extraction of meta-data from semantically heterogeneous collections; and (2) analytical pro- cessing that exploits domain ontologies and associated knowledge bases, with new implementations of map-reduce algorithms on the cloud.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: SWANS proposes a big data processing service-based framework for supporting experts and non-experts analysis on energy consumption. Building big data collections implies analyzing intranets, deep web and open web data, to discover events that cause different energy consumption behaviors, for example, high consumption of energy. SWANS main challenges are the efficient manipulation of huge amounts of data on the cloud with data coming from heterogeneous data sources producing different types of data, smart me- ters, sensors, home and personal utilities. The main objective in SWANS is to address the theoretical aspects of the semantic analytics service?based framework on the cloud thanks to the complementary expertise of all partners and to begin a fruitful col- laboration around Energy Information Systems for energy-care through the development of some big data analysis tools. The Energy Semantics Web Analytic framework will incorporate: (1) the automatic and semi- automatic extraction of meta-data from semantically heterogeneous collections; and (2) analytical pro- cessing that exploits domain ontologies and associated knowledge bases, with new implementations of map-reduce algorithms on the cloud.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Neste projeto, estamos interessados no problema da construção e validação de aplicações web. Em particular, visamos estudar e propor soluções ao problema do descobrimento, adaptação e composição de serviços web. Para isto, usaremos recursos da web semântica na adaptação de serviços web, de forma a alargar o leque de opções, na hora da descoberta dos possíveis participantes de uma determinada composição. Visamos, também, a formulação de uma plataforma de apoio à construção e verificação da composição de componentes, usando a linguagem PEWS como base desta plataforma.
Este projeto 'e de cooperacao internacional, no ambito do programa CAPES-UdelaR. Regina Motz e Alberto Pardo sao professores (grau 5, equivalente ao ptofessor Titular no Brasil) do INCO - Instituto de COmputacao da Universidad de la Republica, Montevideu, Uruguai.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Outras atividades profissionais, cientнficas e tйcnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present a context-free path query evaluation algorithm inspired by top-down parsing techniques. Given a graph and a query defined over a context-free grammar, our algorithm identifies paths on the graph which form words of the language generated by the grammar. We show that our algorithm is correct. We conduct performance evaluation experiments with some popular ontologies and synthetic databases to endorse the efficiency of our approach. The algorithm presents a cubic worst-case runtime complexity in terms of the number of nodes in the graph, which is an improvement over previous work.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We present a context-free path query evaluation algorithm inspired by top-down parsing techniques. The algorithm presents a cubic worst-case runtime complexity in terms of the number of nodes in the graph, which is an improvement over previous work.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Atividades dos serviзos de tecnologia da informaзгo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Transactions on Large-Scale Data- and Knowledge-Centered Systems IX (Journal sub-series)
We introduce a method for building a \textit{minimal} XML type (belonging to standard class of regular tree grammars) as an extension of other given types. Not only do we propose an easy-to-handle XML type evolution method, but we prove that this method computes the smallest extension of a given tree grammar, respecting pre-established constraints. We also adapt our technique to an interactive context, where an advised user is guided to build a new XML type from existing ones. A basic prototype of our tool is implemented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Semantic Web Services testing: A Systematic Mapping study
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Semantic Web Services testing: A Systematic Mapping study

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Semantic Web Service (SWS) is a web service attached with a description that defines its semantic in a computer-interpretable language. This semantic description plays an essential role in the automation of tasks in the web services lifecycle and fills a semantic gap existing in the standard web service technologies. Like any software, an SWS needs to be tested to ensure a certain level of quality. The semantics also plays an important role in the testing process since it can be used as input for testing activities such as the design of test cases and the definition of oracles. In this context, this paper aims to identify and characterize the existing testing initiatives for SWSs by conducting a Systematic Mapping. A rigorous process was followed by defining research questions, conducting a search for primary studies in scientific databases, selecting papers according to pre-defined criteria and analyzing the papers to answer the research questions and to identify trends and gaps in the area. As a result, a total of 43 papers were selected and analyzed concerning a defined classification scheme that reflects the area. The analysis showed the primary goals and issues addressed by the initiatives, the testing techniques applied, evidence on the maturity of the area and trends.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A Semantic Web Service (SWS) is a web service attached with a description that defines its semantic in a computer-interpretable language.
